title: How can work done by spring be found

content.description: A student is conducting an experiment to analyze the mechanical energy of a block-spring system. The student places a block of mass <math alttext="2 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></math> on a horizontal surface and attaches the block to a horizontal spring of negligible mass and spring constant <math alttext="100 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mrow></math>, as shown in the figure. There is negligible friction between the block and the horizontal surface. The other end of the spring is attached to a wall. The block-spring system is initially at the springâ€™s equilibrium position.
content.question: Based on data collected from the experiment, the student creates the graph that shows the force exerted on the spring as a function of the distance the spring is compressed. How can the student use the data to experimentally determine the work done on the spring by the block?

choices.label: Determine the slope of the line of best fit through the data from <math alttext="0.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0.0 m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1.0 m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Determine the area bound by the line of best fit through the data and the horizontal axis from <math alttext="0.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0.0 m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1.0 m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Use the maximum value of the force exerted on the spring and multiply that value by the maximum distance that the spring is compressed.
This graph cannot be used to determine the work done by the block on the spring because the force exerted on the spring by the block is not constant.

content.answer: Determine the area bound by the line of best fit through the data and the horizontal axis from <math alttext="0.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>0.0 m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1.0 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1.0 m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
